briefdescription.para: Constructs an angle from a numeric value.
Returns string representation of the angle.

detaileddescription.para:
Angle is represented in degrees. If the underlying number type is floating point, it is rounded to two decimal places.
String representation of the object.

briefdescription.para: Returns the angle in the given unit.

parameterdescription.para: Unit to return the angle in.

briefdescription.para: Returns this angle as number in range [0, 2pi).
Returns this angle as number in range [-pi, pi).
Returns the shortest signed angle between two angles.

simplesect.para: Takes wrapping and signs into account.

briefdescription.para: Linear interpolation between two angles, using the shortest path.
Returns the sine and cosine of the angle.
Casts the angle to another numeric type.
Returns the underlying numeric scalar value.
Returns this numeric newtype as number in another numeric representation.

parameterdescription.para: Number type. Must satisfy concept rolly::concepts::num.

briefdescription.para: Returns this angle as 32-bit floating-point number.
Returns this angle as 64-bit floating-point number.
Returns true if this angle is a finite number.
Returns the sine of this angle.
Returns the cosine of this angle.
Returns the tangent of this angle.
Returns the arc sine of this angle.
Returns the arc cosine of this angle.
Returns the arc tangent of this angle.
Returns true if underlying value is not 0.
Returns the underlying value as number_type.
Compares this and other angle with rolly::math::approx_eq for equality.

simplesect.para: true if both angles are approximately equal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compares this and other angle with rolly::math::approx_eq for inequality.

simplesect.para: true if both angles are not approximately equal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compares this and other angle for less than.

simplesect.para: true if this angle is less than other, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compares this and other angle for greater than.

simplesect.para: true if this angle is greater than other, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compares this and other angle for less than or equal to.

simplesect.para: true if this angle is less than or equal to other, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compares this and other angle for greater than or equal to.

simplesect.para: true if this angle is greater than or equal to other, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Constructs an angle from another unit.
Constructs an angle with value pi.
Constructs an angle with value pi/2.
Constructs an angle with value pi/3.
Constructs an angle with value pi/4.

detaileddescription.para:
Stores an angle in radians.
T
Number type. Must satisfy concept rolly::concepts::num. Default is f32.
